title: Simple circuits - is Bulb 3 lit with switch open

content.question: A battery, three light bulbs, and a switch are connected in a circuit as shown in the figure. With the switch in the open position, which of the following correctly states if there is a current in Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and provides a correct justification?

choices.label: There is a current in Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> because charge from the battery is repelled and moves as far from the battery as possible, through Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.

There is a current in Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> because Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is part of a closed circuit loop that includes a battery.

There is no current in Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> because charge from the battery will reach the open switch first and will not be able to continue moving to Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.
There is no current in Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> because the switch results in an open circuit, preventing current occurring anywhere in the circuit.

content.answer: There is a current in Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> because Bulb <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is part of a closed circuit loop that includes a battery.
